content:
The HAI IG is a Questionnaire based IG. There are a few profiles that define what has to be in every HAI Questionnaire. The actual specifying of forms (questions, allowed answers, etc.) is done in Questionnaire instances.

Because of this, the value sets are "bound" (allowed answer sets) to items in the Questionnaire.

The problem is, in the IG, on the Value Set pages there is a line printed out that says "This value set is not used."

pasted image

I'm pretty sure this is something that is controlled by the IG publisher and not something I can control. (Though I may be wrong on that - wanted to ask the question before I did a ton of work trawling through framework files).

If this is the case and it's not something I can control, is this a change we (and by "we" I mean @Grahame Grieve !) could make to the IG publisher to get it to NOT print out that message if the value set is bound to a Questionnaire (and I guess maybe PlanDefinition would be in the same boat, maybe others?)?

If it is something I can control, I will fix it!

(We got a ballot comment on this btw - from @Rob Hausam ... And even if we didn't get a comment - it's not really accurate that it's not used.)
it's an IG publisher issue. If you get any comments, just dispose of them with 'this will be fixed in the next publication'
Ok, thanks. Kind of said that in the comment (that has already been disposed)... So if we publish this IG in the next 3 or 4 weeks, will it be fixed by then?
I have a couple of days reserved next work to work on an IG that is all questionnaire, so I'll fix it then
